intro: Hirtella mucronata, commonly known as the hairy hirtella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink and are clustered in inflorescences. Hirtella mucronata is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
